clinical_study.brief_title: LUS in Acute Heart Failure Therapeutic Adaptation
clinical_study.official_title: Interest of Lung Ultrasound (LUS) in Therapeutic Adaptation of Patients Hospitalized in Medical Department for Acute Heart Failure (AHF).

brief_summary.textblock: Evaluate lung ultrasound aspect according to diuretics dosage evolution in patients hospitalized for acute heart failure.

detailed_description.textblock: EPPICA is an observational and prospective cohort study. The study goal is to evaluate LUS aspect evolution according to diuretics dosage in patients hospitalized for acute heart failure.

primary_outcome.measure: Lung ultrasound aspect according to diuretics dosage evolution.
primary_outcome.time_frame: LUS will be performed daily during the whole hospitalisation length (on average 7 days).

secondary_outcome.measure: Lung ultrasound aspect according to clinical signs of acute heart failure (crackling auscultation or lower limbs edema)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: LUS and clinical examination will be performed daily during the whole hospitalisation length (on average 7 days).

secondary_outcome.measure: Lung ultrasound aspect according to acute kidney injury (based on plasmatic creatinine levels).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: LUS will be performed daily during the whole hospitalisation length (on average 7 days). Plasmatic creatinine measure will be performed at least weekly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Lung ultrasound aspect according to early prognosis (re-hospitalisation or mortality within 30 days after discharge)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: LUS will be performed daily during the whole hospitalisation length (on average 7 days). Patient will be called 30 days after discharge.

secondary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of daily LUS in medical department.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: LUS will be performed daily during the whole hospitalisation length (on average 7 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Number of LUS performed compared to number of hospitalisation days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Interest of LUS compared to clinical examination at discharge.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: LUS and clinical examination will be performed daily during the whole hospitalisation length (on average 7 days).
secondary_outcome.description: B-lines at discharge compared to clinical signs of acute heart failure.

arm_group.description: Patients hospitalized for acute heart failure in medical department.

intervention.description: We will perform daily a lung ultrasound to evaluate pulmonary congestion by counting B-lines.

study_pop.textblock: Patients aged over 18, hospitalized from the emergency department in the medical department for acute heart failure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Acute heart failure diagnosed by a senior physician in the medical department, with a confirmation of a second senior physician.
- Hospitalised in the medical department.
- No objection from the patient of his trusted person.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Administrative supervision or deprived of their liberty
- Pulmonary conditions distracting lung ultrasound (pneumonectomy, pulmonary fibrosis)
- Chronically dialysed
